content: The Act may be cited as the "Medical Devices Technical Corrections Act" and includes technical corrections regarding Public Law 107-250. In clause (iv)(I), changes are made to inspections of device establishments, including specifying inspections during the previous 4 years and adding "section" after "pursuant to." Additionally, the requirement for a commercial reason for a waiver is removed, and the timeframe for granting waivers is adjusted. In clause (iv)(II), amendments are made to inspectional findings of device establishments, including adding "of a device establishment required to register" after "to be conducted" and inserting "section" after "pursuant to." Furthermore, adjustments are made to the description of compliance with sections 501 and 502, and the term "inspections" is replaced with "inspectional findings." In paragraph (6)(B)(iv), amendments allow the Secretary to suspend inspections by accredited persons if a device establishment is found to be substantially non-compliant within two years of clearance under subparagraph (A).
